private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are vowels: A, E, I.
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks to achieve the target stacking where A is on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, and N is on the table.

private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are consonants: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N, etc.
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks to achieve the target stacking where A is on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, and N is on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their local observations and proposed moves into a global plan.
I must produce a PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards planner and keep the agents actions distinct.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that, when solved by FastDownwards, yields a valid multi-agent plan respecting top-of-stack constraints and the vowel/consonant action restrictions to achieve the target stacking.

public_information: There are 14 blocks labeled: G K E H A C M L N I F B D J.
Initial stacking configuration: G is on the table.
E is on top of G.
H is on top of K.
A is on top of H.
C is on top of A.
M is on top of E.
L is on top of M.
N is on top of L.
I is on top of N.
F is on top of C.
B is on top of F.
D is on top of I.
J is on top of D.
Agents can only manipulate blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
Each agent may move only one block at a time.
One agent may only interact with vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I); the other may only interact with consonant-labeled blocks.
Goal configuration: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on the table.

local_report.system_prompt: You are the vowel agent. Inspect the environment public information and your private information. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise report listing which top-of-stack blocks you are currently authorized to move (vowel-labeled blocks you can access), any blocking relationships you observe that prevent those moves, and a suggested sequence of local actions in plain text that only involve vowel-labeled blocks and adhere to top-of-stack and one-block-at-a-time constraints. If you lack information, report only what you can see and assume nothing beyond your private and public information.
local_report.prompt: Agent name: vowel_agent. Use the environment public information and your private information to produce a local report. State current accessible vowel top blocks, blocking constraints, and a short ordered list of proposed local moves using a format like 'move A from X to Y' where X and Y are table or block names. Keep the response concise and in plain text.

local_report.system_prompt: You are the consonant agent. Inspect the environment public information and your private information. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise report listing which top-of-stack blocks you are currently authorized to move (consonant-labeled blocks you can access), any blocking relationships you observe that prevent those moves, and a suggested sequence of local actions in plain text that only involve consonant-labeled blocks and adhere to top-of-stack and one-block-at-a-time constraints. If you lack information, report only what you can see and assume nothing beyond your private and public information.
local_report.prompt: Agent name: consonant_agent. Use the environment public information and your private information to produce a local report. State current accessible consonant top blocks, blocking constraints, and a short ordered list of proposed local moves using a format like 'move B from X to Y' where X and Y are table or block names. Keep the response concise and in plain text.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the local reports from the vowel and consonant agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted to the FastDownwards planner. You must model multi-agent constraints by keeping agent-specific actions distinct (for example, give actions for vowel_agent and consonant_agent or use parameters that enforce which agent can move which block). Model blocks, table, on, clear, holding, and turn or agent ownership predicates as needed. Ensure actions enforce that only top blocks can be moved and that vowel/consonant restrictions are respected. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The produced PDDL must be self-contained and solvable by FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the following local reports into a unified PDDL modeling the multi-agent blocksworld and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards. Keep actions of vowel_agent and consonant_agent distinct in the domain or via clear agent constraints. Use the public initial configuration and the global goal. Output only the domain and problem enclosed by <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags. The inputs to consider are: {report_vowel} {report_consonant}.
